intro: Caulanthus major, commonly known as the showy goldfields, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has basal leaves that are linear and often covered in fine hairs. Caulanthus major is an annual herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting pollinator populations.
